name: SetDefaultGithubActionsPermissions
description:
Configure default GitHub Actions permissions for an organization.

This tool sets the default workflow permissions for the `GITHUB_TOKEN` in an organization and determines if GitHub Actions can submit approving pull request reviews. It's essential to authenticate using an access token with `admin:org` scope, or GitHub Apps must have the `administration` permission. Use it to manage organizational GitHub Actions settings.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the organization. Not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: default_github_token_permissions
parameters.description: The default permissions granted to the GITHUB_TOKEN when running workflows. Options are 'read' or 'write'.

value_schema.description: The default workflow permissions granted to the GITHUB_TOKEN when running workflows.

parameters.name: allow_actions_to_approve_pull_requests
parameters.description: Allow GitHub Actions to approve pull requests. Enabling this may pose a security risk.

value_schema.description: Whether GitHub Actions can approve pull requests. Enabling this can be a security risk.
